column5: News items I just read in our local papers.   First, the tool in Algonquin.  http://www.tbsource.com/Localnews/index.asp?cid=96935  Then, the oddity. Deer encounter in Minnesota, lol.  http://www.chroniclejournal.com/CP_stories.php?id=48736
What a bonehead ! RE: Algonquin Story.
Some people dont have any brains eh... might as well have left his business card at a robbery too

well the first story.....they are all idiots,what stupid people do is astonishing and the lucky marathon runner is very lucky to not have had more serious injuries than that,i thinks its a first for that catagory...lol..lol....
Funny Story but it was in Quetico not APP.  Just like the idiots that spray painted Maple Mountain in Temagami.  They caught them sort of.. the same way.

Kind of brings up a question I have.  Correct me if I'm wrong.  There was a huge old Pine tree that was famous as a one of Tom Thompson's famous portraits.  A unique Canadian Treasure.  I believe this tree was on Grand Lake in Achray.  Can somebody shed some light on how this tree was cut down.  Apparently campers.
Died in the mid 70's and was then cut down and used for firewood by campers in 1979.  jjcanoe
"The only way to preserve old growth white pine is to turn it into a nice piece of furniture like this desk here"  Quote from a Tembec Lumber Mill manager circa 1973
Maybe they should have inscribed something into his trunk!  Stupid moron.
.....the actions of a totally moronic jackass........
